16.heading: Zacchilli, Mickey.
16.title: RAV : 1st Collection
16.author: by Mickey Zacchilli.
notes: "RAV is an action-adventure romance drone comic that has been likened to such epic works as Alice in Wonderland and Ulysses. Follow Juice, Sally, The Snake Prince, a mystery cat and other bizarre friends as they navigate an esoteric whirlwind of dorks, punks, passive-agression, kisses, weird basements, and bad breakfast spots. This tome collects the first five issues of Mickey Zacchilli's enigmatic and hilarious series, as well as drawings & ephemera."

17.heading: Zacchilli, Mickey.
17.title: This is a Comic Book : August 1-22, 2009, Mahan Gallery.
17.author: [No author]
notes: "This catalogue is published in conjunction with the exhibition 'This is a comic book' curated by Jim Payne and Colleen Grennan."

Includes works by Anders Nilsen, Closed Caption Comics, Cole Johnson, Dorothy Gambrell, John Porcellino, Lauren Weinstein, Jane Lee, Matt Furie, Mickey Zacchilli, Mike Taylor, Nate Powell, Panayiotis Terzis, Phonzie Davis, and Ron Rege Jr., with brief biographies of each.

18.title: "I Still Have 2 Seasons of Gossip Girl to Go!"

20.heading: Zach, David.
20.title: Zachronyms : Funny Words for Funny Times

notes: Words coined as acronyms, illustrated by cartoons.

21.heading: Zach, Jen.
21.title: Roswell, Texas : a Story
21.author: by L
21.appears_in: Neil Smith and Rex F. May ; illustrated by Scott Bieser and Jen Zach.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): In an alternative universe, Davy Crocket survived the 1836 siege at the Alamo, and Santa Ana did not. As a result, Texas remained an independent republic and never joined the United States. In 1947, Texican President Charles A. Lindbergh learns that a flying saucer has crashed near the far west Texas town of Roswell. He dispatches his best friend, "Wild Bill" Bear, and three of his best Texas Rangers, to investigate. Our four heroes find themselves in a race against agents from the United States, the Franco-Mexican Empire, the California Republic, and the Third-and-a-half Reich, to find that crashed saucer and learn its secrets.

22.heading: Zach in the Land of the Faeries.
22.title: Teething Pains : in which Zach Frisbee Meets a Tooth Fairy and Discovers He's Bitten Off More than He Can Chew.

24.heading: Zacharias, Carter.
24.title: The Masterplan
24.author: by Scott Mills.
notes: "Carter Zacharias is a man with a mission, a scientist who will stop at nothing to save the universe itself from its unrelenting expansin, and God help any man, woman or planet that gets in his way. When stars shatter and worlds collide, remember, it's all part of The Masterplan."

34.heading: Zack.
34.title: Baja : Heroes, Villains, and Everyone In Between
34.author: story by Ben Wagner ; art by Nathan St John ; letters by Tom B
notes: "In this sexy, twisting thriller, Hil and Zack
a beautiful woman and a man who knows better

must escape a stalker whose fate is tied to their own. St John and Wagner play with conventions, leading readers in unexpected directions with a story that deftly weaves two tales of love, sex, greed, and betrayal."

35.heading: Zack.
35.title: Coldfinger
35.author: written by Donald Lemke ; illustrated by Douglas Holgate.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): While on a winter vacation with his family, Zack must stop a plot by Dr. Icee to freeze Metro City with a giant freezer ray and overcome his fear of sports after a bully challenges him to a ski competition.

36.heading: Zack.
36.title: "The Cyclop Caper"
36.author: Jack Cole
notes: Summary: Plastic Man gets help stopping a gang from Omar McGootch of the Western Union (introduced here), but Omar Keeps messing up.
Villains are Cyclop (introduced here) and Zack.
Data from Lou Mougin, Len Wolinsky, Gregory Fischer, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

37.heading: Zack.

38.heading: Zack.
38.title: The Suite Life of Zack & Cody
38.author: editor, Julie Taylor.
notes: "Based on the television series "The Suite Life of Zack & Cody."

Summary (from OCLC): Twins Zack and Cody discover who their true friends are after they invite the cool crowd to a party at the swanky hotel where they live, while Maddie pretends to be a rich heiress in the hopes of impressing a hotel guest, but when she can't hide her humble roots, she finds out if her crush can accept her for who she really is.

75.heading: Zadok, Erez, 1986-
75.title: Passover Haggadah Graphic Novel = Hagadah shel Pesah
75.author: Jordan B
75.appears_in: Gorfinkel, creator & writer ; Erez Zadok, artist ; David Olivestone, translator.

publication info.place: Jerusalem, Israel ; New Milford, CT, USA
publication info.publisher: Koren ; United States : ACE, Avalanche Comics Entertainment

notes: "Integrates a brand-new translation directly into the art. The graphic novel pages are presented alongside the complete Seder text, in Hebrew and transliteration, and accompanied by instructional cartoons depicting all of the rituals."
"Joseph Gelles, transliteration ; Rabbi Burton Visotsky, Rabbi Moshe Berger, Ariel Stein, scholars."
"Rabbi David Fuchs, Rabbi Yinon Chen, scholars & content editors."

76.heading: Zadok, Erez, 1986-
76.title: Tranquillo : Based on a True Story
76.author: Erez Zadok.
notes: "July 4, 2009 is a date I probably won't forget soon. Defending my innocence in an immigration interrogation room when entering the U.S. was really not the way I planned on concluding my big trip. To answer the investigator's questions, I found myself exposing personal experiences and events from my trip to South America, hoping that my story would help me leave the interrogation without a black stamp on my passport."

94.heading: Zaft.
94.title: Mobile Suit Gundam Seed
94.author: original story by Hajime Yatate and Yoshiyuki Tomino ; written by Liu Goto ; illustrated by Tomofumi Ogasawara ; translation, Sue Shambaugh.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): In cosmic era 70, genetically enhanced Coordinators, Zaft, are at war with biologically unaltered Naturals, the Earth Alliance Force. When 5 of the Earth Alliance Force's secret weapons are stolen by Zaft, Kira Yamato, a shy young student, becomes involved in the war when he uses his Coordinator abilities to protect his Natural friends. The hopes and fears of a new generation clash with the greatest weapons developed by mankind, Gundam.

185.title: "Zagro, Tyrant of Saturn"
185.author: art: Joe Doolin
notes: Villains are Zagro (introduced here and dies), and Saturnians; introduction of Bill Taylor, Flo Davis, and an old scientist who dies.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

186.heading: Zagu.
186.title: "The City of the Spidermen"
186.author: art: Ken Jackson
notes: Introduction of The Red Comet; villains are Zagu and the Spidermen, introduced and dying here.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

187.heading: Zagula.
187.title: "Valley of Golden Death"
187.author: W
187.appears_in: Morgan Thomas ; Robert Webb, pencils. 12 p. in Jumbo Comics, no. 62 (Apr. 1944).
notes: Begins: "There's a safari ahead, Bob! Let's see where"
Villains are Bronson, Ligao, Creeper, and another crook (all introduced here and all die) ; introduction of Zagula's daughter and of Zagula, who dies.
Data from Lou Mougin, Henry Steele, Hames Ware & Jim Vadeboncoeur Jr. via Grand Comics Database Project.
